title: Social Pedagogical Instructional Design Integration for Accessible E-Learning Material Development

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced domain-specific expertise (Universal Design for Learning, digital literacy), extensive practical experience, and understanding of inclusive education philosophy
context.additional_context: Emphasizes e-learning material development capabilities considering accessibility for marginalized groups in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Requires curriculum design reflecting the needs of diverse learner groups such as low-income individuals, people with disabilities, and the elderly

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three e-learning material design principles (e.g., universal design for learning, cultural accessibility) considering diverse disability types and social contexts.

Learners analyze social accessibility barriers (e.g., digital divide) using general instructional design tools (e.g., constructivist learning theory, collaborative learning design tools) and write a report.
Learners prototype mobile-optimized accessible e-learning content (documents/videos) and validate its educational effectiveness and social inclusivity through peer evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
